tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字にしました

sen.j: 柳川一件（やながわいっけん）とは、江戸時代初期に対馬藩主宗義成（そうよしなり）と家老柳川調興（やながわしげおき）が日本と李氏朝鮮の間で交わされた国書の偽造を巡って対立した事件。
sen.e: Yanagawa ikken was the incident in which the lord of the Tsushima Domain Yoshinari SO and the chief retainer Shigeoki YANAGAWA confronted each other over the forgery of sovereign's message exchanged between Japan and Joseon Dynasty in early Edo period.

The Yanagawa Ikken was an incident in which Yoshinari SO, the lord of the Tsushima Domain, and his chief retainer Shigeoki YANAGAWA confronted each other over forgery of the sovereign's message exchanged between Japan and Joseon Dynasty in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の追加・削除、ikkenの頭文字を大文字にしました（出来事の名前、固有名詞なので）
sen.e: The Yanagawa Ikken was an incident in which Yoshinari SO, the lord of the Tsushima Domain, and his chief retainer Shigeoki YANAGAWA confronted each other over forgery of the sovereign's message exchanged between Japan and Joseon Dynasty in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 事件の経緯
sen.e: Circumstances behind the Incident
Circumstances behind the Incident
Circumstances behind the Incident

sen.j: 16世紀末、日本の豊臣政権による朝鮮出兵（文禄・慶長の役）が行われ、日朝、日明関係が断絶した。
sen.e: In the end of 16th century the Toyotomi government in Japan dispatched troops to Korea (the Bunroku-Keicho War), breaking off the relationship between Ming Dynasty and Japan, as well as between Korea and Japan.

In the end of 16th century, the Toyotomi government of Japan dispatched troops to Korea (the Bunroku-Keicho War), breaking off the relationship between Ming Dynasty and Japan, as well as the one between Korea and Japan.
sen.cmt: カンマの追加、as well as とbetweenの間にthe one を追加しました
sen.e: In the end of 16th century, the Toyotomi government of Japan dispatched troops to Korea (the Bunroku-Keicho War), breaking off the relationship between Ming Dynasty and Japan, as well as the one between Korea and Japan.

sen.j: 戦後、日本で徳川家康による江戸幕府が成立すると、徳川氏は李氏朝鮮、明との国交正常化交渉を開始する。
sen.e: After the war, when Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was established by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Tokugawa clan started talks for the normalization of diplomatic relations between Japan and Joseon Dynasty or Ming Dynasty.

After the war, when the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was established by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the Tokugawa clan started to speak to Joseon Dynasty and Ming Dynasty to normalize the diplomatic relations between Japan and these countries.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を追加しました。後半、書き直しました。
sen.e: After the war, when the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was established by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the Tokugawa clan started to speak to Joseon Dynasty and Ming Dynasty to normalize the diplomatic relations between Japan and these countries.

sen.j: 日本と朝鮮の中間に位置する対馬藩は地理的条件から経済を朝鮮との交易に依存していた背景もあり、朝鮮との国交回復のため、朝鮮出兵の際に連れて来られた捕虜の送還をはじめ日朝交渉を仲介した。
sen.e: Tsushima Domain, located between Japan and Korea, had economically depended on the trade with Korea because of its geographical conditions; therefore, for the restoration of diplomatic relations with Korea the Domain acted as mediator between Japan and Korea such as sending back Korean captives brought to Japan during the dispatch of troops to Korea.

The Tsushima Domain, which was located between Japan and Korea, had economically depended on trade with Korea because of its geographical conditions; therefore, for the sake of the restoration of diplomatic relations with Korea, the Domain acted as a mediator between Japan and Korea and they had some activities such as sending back Korean captives who had been brought to Japan during Japan's Invasions of Korea.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の追加・削除、関係代名詞の挿入、「朝鮮出兵」はここでは出来事の名称として固有名詞としたほうがわかりやすいため、「 Japan's Invation of Korea」を採用しました。
sen.e: The Tsushima Domain, which was located between Japan and Korea, had economically depended on trade with Korea because of its geographical conditions; therefore, for the sake of the restoration of diplomatic relations with Korea, the Domain acted as a mediator between Japan and Korea and they had some activities such as sending back Korean captives who had been brought to Japan during Japan's Invasions of Korea.

sen.j: 朝鮮側から朝鮮出兵の際の戦犯を差し出すように要求されたため、対馬藩は藩内の（朝鮮出兵とは全く無関係の）罪人の喉を水銀で潰して声を発せられなくした上で「朝鮮出兵の戦犯」として差し出した。
sen.e: When Korea demanded that Japan give war criminals of the dispatch of troops to Korea, Tsushima Domain gave the offenders in the Domain (having no relation to the dispatch) as war criminals, after harming the offenders on the throat with mercury so that they were unable to talk.

When Korea demanded that Japan should hand over war criminals of Japan's Invasions of Korea, the Tsushima Domain handed over criminals in the domain (who had nothing to do with the invasions) as war criminals, after harming their throats with mercury so that they were unable to talk.
sen.cmt: 助動詞shouldの挿入、「罪人」をcriminalsに変更、「差し出す」をhand overに変更、「無関係」をhad nothing to do withに変更、「harming the offenders on the throat」をharming their throatsに変更しました。
sen.e: When Korea demanded that Japan should hand over war criminals of Japan's Invasions of Korea, the Tsushima Domain handed over criminals in the domain (who had nothing to do with the invasions) as war criminals, after harming their throats with mercury so that they were unable to talk.

sen.j: このような対馬藩の形振り構わぬ工作活動の結果、朝鮮側は（満州の女真族（後金）の勢力拡大で北方防備の必要もあったため）交渉に宥和的となった。
sen.e: As a result of such desperate maneuver activities by Tsushima Domain, Korea became appeased and positive with the negotiations (partly because the need for northern defense increased due to the expanded power of the Joshin tribe [Kokin] in Manchuria.)

As a result of such desperate maneuver activities by the Tsushima Domain, Korea became appeased and positive with the negotiations (partly because the need for northern defense increased due to the expanded power of the Joshin tribe [Kokin] in Manchuria.)
sen.cmt: 「Tsushima Domain」の前に冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: As a result of such desperate maneuver activities by the Tsushima Domain, Korea became appeased and positive with the negotiations (partly because the need for northern defense increased due to the expanded power of the Joshin tribe [Kokin] in Manchuria.)

sen.j: 1605年、朝鮮側が徳川政権から先に国書を送るように要求してきたのに対し、対馬藩は国書の偽造を行い朝鮮へ提出した。
sen.e: In 1605 when Korea demanded that Tokugawa government send sovereign's message first, Tsushima Domain forged sovereign's massage and presented it to Korea.
In 1605, when Korea demanded that the Tokugawa government should send the sovereign's message first, the Tsushima Domain forged the sovereign's massage and presented it to Korea.
sen.cmt: カンマと冠詞の追加しました。
sen.e: In 1605, when Korea demanded that the Tokugawa government should send the sovereign's message first, the Tsushima Domain forged the sovereign's massage and presented it to Korea.

sen.j: 書式から偽書の疑いが生じたものの朝鮮は「回答使」（対馬藩は幕府に「通信使」と偽った）を派遣した。
sen.e: Although the message was suspected of apocryphal book from the difference in form, Korea dispatched a responder (Tsushima Domain misled the Edo bakufu giving a false name of Emissary.)
Although the message was suspected of a faked letter due to its format, Korea dispatched a responder (the Tsushima Domain gave the Edo bakufu false information that the messenger was an emissary.)
sen.cmt: 「偽書」は用語集で「apocryphal book」となっていますが、ここでは本ではないので「faked letter」としておきました。「対馬藩は幕府に「通信使」と偽った」の部分を書き換えました。
sen.e: Although the message was suspected of a faked letter due to its format, Korea dispatched a responder (the Tsushima Domain gave the Edo bakufu false information that the messenger was an emissary.)

sen.j: 使節は江戸城で2代将軍徳川秀忠、駿府で大御所の家康と謁見した。
sen.e: The envoy had an audience with Hidetada TOKUGAWA the second shogunate in Edo-jo Castle, and with Ogosho Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Sunpu.
The envoy had an audience with the second shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA at Edo-jo Castle, and with Ogosho (the retired shogun) Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Sunpu.
sen.cmt: shogunateをshogunに変更、the second shogunの位置を変更、「大御所」の英訳を追加しました。。
sen.e: The envoy had an audience with the second shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA at Edo-jo Castle, and with Ogosho (the retired shogun) Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Sunpu.

sen.j: 対馬藩は回答使の返書も改竄し、1617年、1624年と三次に渡る交渉でもそれぞれ国書の偽造、改竄を行い、1609年には貿易協定である己酉約条を締結させた。
sen.e: Tsushima Domain altered also the reply from responder, and over the third negotiations that followed including ones in 1617 and 1624, the Domain forged and altered sovereign's message while in 1609 Tsushima Domain concluded Kiyu Agreement (trade agreement between Korea and Tsushima Domain).

The Tsushima Domain also modified the reply brought by the responder, as well as diplomatic messages of the second and the third negotiations respectively held in 1617 and in 1624, and the domain forged and modified the sovereign's message, so that the Kiyu Agreement (trade agreement between Korea and Tsushima Domain) was concluded in 1609.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました。
sen.e: The Tsushima Domain also modified the reply brought by the responder, as well as diplomatic messages of the second and the third negotiations respectively held in 1617 and in 1624, and the domain forged and modified the sovereign's message, so that the Kiyu Agreement (trade agreement between Korea and Tsushima Domain) was concluded in 1609.

sen.j: 対馬藩の家老であった柳川調興は主家（宗義成）から独立して旗本への昇格を狙っており、藩主である宗義成と対立した。
sen.e: The chief retainer of Tsushima Domain, Shigeoki YANAGAWA, who aimed to become independent from master's house (Yoshinari SO) and to be promoted to hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu), was opposed to the lord of Tsushima Domain Yoshinari SO.

Shigeoki YANAGAWA, the chief retainer of the Tsushima Domain, who aimed to become independent from his master's house (Yoshinari SO) to be promoted to a hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu), opposed to Yoshinari SO, the lord of the Tsushima Domain.
sen.cmt: 語順の変更、冠詞の追加、文法の誤り（opposeの用法）の修正しました。
sen.e: Shigeoki YANAGAWA, the chief retainer of the Tsushima Domain, who aimed to become independent from his master's house (Yoshinari SO) to be promoted to a hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu), opposed to Yoshinari SO, the lord of the Tsushima Domain.

sen.j: そのため、対馬藩の国書改竄の事実を、幕府に対して訴え出た。
sen.e: Therefore, YANAGAWA laid a complaint before the bakufu for the alteration of sovereign's message by Tsushima Domain.
Therefore, Yanagawa complained to the bakufu for the modification of diplomatic messages done by Tsushima Domain.
sen.cmt: YANAGAWAを小文字に、「laid a complaint before the bakufu」を「complained to the bakufu」に変更、国書を「diplomatic messages」に、「改竄」をmodificationに変更しました
sen.e: Therefore, Yanagawa complained to the bakufu for the modification of diplomatic messages done by Tsushima Domain.

sen.j: 大名・幕閣の動向
sen.e: Movement of Daimyo and the Cabinet Officials of Shogunate
Movement of Daimyo and the Cabinet Officials of Shogunate
Movement of Daimyo and the Cabinet Officials of Shogunate

sen.j: 当時、戦国時代 (日本)の下克上の風潮が残存していた。
sen.e: At that time there remained the tendency for gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite) in the Sengoku period (the Age of Civil Wars in Japan).
At that time there remained an atmosphere for gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite) in the the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: the tendencyをan atomosphereに変更、「戦国時代」を用語統一シートで指定されている語に変更しました。
sen.e: At that time there remained an atmosphere for gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite) in the the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 柳川は、家康の覚えも良く、幕閣有力者からの支持もあり、「幕府も日朝貿易の実権を直接握りたいであろう」との推測から、勝算があると考えていた。
sen.e: YANAGAWA stood high in Ieyasu's esteem, and received support from the influential cabinet officials of the Shogunate, and conjecturing that the bakufu hoped to seize real power over Japan-Korea Trade, he believed that he stood a fair chance of success.

Yanagawa stood high in Ieyasu's favor, and received support from influential cabinet officials of the Shogunate, and conjecturing that the bakufu hoped to seize real power over Japan-Korea Trade, he believed that he stood a fair chance of success.
sen.cmt: YANAGAWAとなっていたのを頭文字以外を小文字に、esteemをfavorに変更しました。
sen.e: Yanagawa stood high in Ieyasu's favor, and received support from influential cabinet officials of the Shogunate, and conjecturing that the bakufu hoped to seize real power over Japan-Korea Trade, he believed that he stood a fair chance of success.

sen.j: 一方、仙台藩主伊達政宗など、宗義成を支持する大名もおり、彼らは、戦国時代が完全に終ったことを印象付けるために、この事件を利用する方向で動いた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the lord of the Sendai Domain Masamune Date and other daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) supported Yoshinari SO, and they acted to use this incident to convey the impression that the Sengoku period (period of civil war) came to an end completely.

On the other hand, Masamune DATE, who was the lord of the Sendai Domain, and some other daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) supported Yoshinari SO, and they attempted to take advantage of this incident to convey the impression that the Sengoku Period came to the end completely.
sen.cmt: DateをDATEに、「Masamune DATE」の位置を変更、otherの前にsomeを追加、lordを複数形に、actedをattemptedに、useをtake advantege ofにそれぞれ変更、「戦国時代」の英訳は既出なので削除、an endをthe endに変更しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Masamune DATE, who was the lord of the Sendai Domain, and some other daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) supported Yoshinari SO, and they attempted to take advantage of this incident to convey the impression that the Sengoku Period came to the end completely.

sen.j: 家光の判断
sen.e: Judgment of Iemitsu
Judgment of Iemitsu
Judgment of Iemitsu

sen.j: 寛永12年（1635年）3月11日、三代将軍徳川家光の目の前で、宗義成、柳川調興の直接の口頭弁論が行われた。
sen.e: In 1635 oral procedure by Yoshinari SO and Shigeoki YANAGAWA was conducted in the presence of Iemitsu TOKUGAWA the third shogunate.
In 1635, oral proceedings by Yoshinari SO and Shigeoki YANAGAWA were conducted in the presence of the third Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: カンマの追加、procedureをproceedingsに変更（動詞も変更）、ShogunateをShogunに変更しました。
sen.e: In 1635, oral proceedings by Yoshinari SO and Shigeoki YANAGAWA were conducted in the presence of the third Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 江戸にいる大名が総登城し、江戸城大広間で対決の様子が公開された。
sen.e: All the daimyo living in Edo (present-day Tokyo) went to Edo-jo Castle, and everything about their confrontation was open to the public in a hall of the castle.
All the daimyo living in Edo (present-day Tokyo) went to Edo-jo Castle, and everything about their confrontation was open to the public in a hall of the castle.
All the daimyo living in Edo (present-day Tokyo) went to Edo-jo Castle, and everything about their confrontation was open to the public in a hall of the castle.

sen.j: 結果、幕府としては従前同様に日朝貿易は対馬藩に委ねたほうが得策と判断し、宗義成は無罪、柳川調興は津軽地方に流罪とされた。
sen.e: As a result, the Edo bakufu judged that it would be wise to leave Japan-Korea Trade to Tsushima Domain as before, and Yoshinari SO was found innocent while Shigeoki YANAGAWA was sentenced to banishment to Tsugaru region.

As a result, the Edo bakufu judged that it would be wise to leave Japan-Korea Trade to the Tsushima Domain as before, and Yoshinari SO was found innocent while Shigeoki YANAGAWA was sentenced to banishment to the Tsugaru region.
sen.cmt: Tsushima DomainとTsugaru regionの前にそれぞれ冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: As a result, the Edo bakufu judged that it would be wise to leave Japan-Korea Trade to the Tsushima Domain as before, and Yoshinari SO was found innocent while Shigeoki YANAGAWA was sentenced to banishment to the Tsugaru region.

sen.j: この事件の後、幕府は国書に記す将軍の称号を「日本国王」から「日本国大君」に改め、京都五山の僧に外交文書作成や使節の応接、貿易の監視などを命じた。
sen.e: After this incident, the Edo bakufu changed shogun's title described in sovereign's message from "King of Japan" to "Tycoon of Japan", and charged Buddhist priests in Five Great Zen Temples of Kyoto with preparation of diplomatic papers, reception of envoy and observation of trade while Japan-Korea Trade was under the bakufu's severe control although it was put into the hands of Tsushima Domain as before.

After this incident, the Edo bakufu changed the shogun's title which should be stated in any diplomatic letters from "King of Japan" to "Tycoon of Japan," and told Buddhist priests in Five Great Zen Temples of Kyoto to prepare diplomatic papers and receptions for envoys, and to observe trades.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。「described in sovereign's message」を「which should be stated in any diplomatic letters」に変更しました。後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: After this incident, the Edo bakufu changed the shogun's title which should be stated in any diplomatic letters from "King of Japan" to "Tycoon of Japan," and told Buddhist priests in Five Great Zen Temples of Kyoto to prepare diplomatic papers and receptions for envoys, and to observe trades.

sen.j: 日朝貿易は以前と同じく対馬藩に委ねられたものの、幕府の厳しい管理下に置かれた。
sen.e: The Japan-Korea Trade was under the bakufu's severe control although it was put into the hands of the Tsushima Domain as before.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。Tsushima Domainの前に冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: The Japan-Korea Trade was under the bakufu's severe control although it was put into the hands of the Tsushima Domain as before.
